intro: Tarenna scaberula, commonly known as the rough tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, elliptical leaves with a rough texture. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, followed by small, fleshy berries. Tarenna scaberula is often found in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforests of Madagascar.
